question:
What is the default alignment of number in an Excel worksheet?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 12/06/2022 (Shift-I)
solution:
• In an Excel worksheet, numbers are by default aligned to the right side of the cell.
  • This default right alignment helps differentiate numbers from text, which is aligned to the left by default.
  • The other options like left, center, and justify alignment are not the default settings for numbers in Excel cells.

Additional Information:

  • Text data in Excel aligns left by default, making it easier to distinguish from numerical data.
  • You can change alignment manually, but the default for numbers remains right.
  • Justify alignment is generally used for paragraph text, not for numbers in Excel cells.

question:
What is the default vertical alignment of texts in an Excel worksheet?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 13/06/2022 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The default vertical alignment of texts in an Excel worksheet is Bottom.
  • This means text inside a cell is aligned to the bottom edge of the cell by default.
  • Other options like Top, Center, and Justify are available but not the default vertical alignment for text.
  • This default helps keep data visually consistent, especially when cell heights change.

Additional Information:

  • You can manually change vertical alignment to Top, Center, or Justify through cell formatting options.
  • Numbers in Excel also follow Bottom vertical alignment by default.
  • Proper alignment improves readability and presentation of data in worksheets.

question:
What is the address of the cell in the seventh column of the sixth row in an MS-Excel worksheet?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 17/06/2022 (Shift-II)
solution:
• In MS-Excel, columns are labeled with letters (A, B, C, …), and rows are labeled with numbers (1, 2, 3, …).
  • The seventh column corresponds to the letter G (A=1, B=2, …, G=7).
  • The sixth row corresponds to the number 6.
  • Therefore, the address of the cell in the seventh column and sixth row is G6.
  • Other options like F6 or F7 refer to the sixth or seventh column respectively, which is incorrect for this question.

Additional Information:

  • Cell addresses in Excel always combine the column letter first, followed by the row number.
  • Understanding cell addressing is important for formulas and data referencing in Excel.
  • This format is known as the A1 reference style, the default in Excel.

question:
What is the address of the cell in the tenth row of the fifth column in an MS-Excel worksheet?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 17/06/2022 (Shift-III)
solution:
• In MS-Excel, columns are labeled with letters starting from A, B, C, and so on.
  • The fifth column corresponds to the letter E (A=1, B=2, C=3, D=4, E=5).
  • Rows are labeled with numbers starting from 1, 2, 3, etc.
  • The tenth row corresponds to the number 10.
  • Therefore, the cell address for the tenth row and fifth column is E10.
  • Other options like 10E, 5J, or J5 do not follow Excel’s column-row addressing format.

Additional Information:

  • The standard cell reference format in Excel is column letter followed by row number.
  • Knowing this helps when writing formulas or referencing cells in Excel.
  • This addressing style is called the A1 reference style.

question:
In an Excel worksheet, the content of the active cell is displayed in ___________.

RRB NTPC Stage-II 15/06/2022 (Shift-III)
solution:
• In an Excel worksheet, the content of the active cell is displayed in the Formula Bar.
  • The Formula Bar shows the data or formula entered in the currently selected cell.
  • The Title Bar displays the name of the workbook window.
  • The Name Box shows the address or name of the active cell but not its content.
  • The Status Bar provides information about the current state of Excel, like sum, average, or mode of selected cells.

Additional Information:

  • You can also edit the content of the active cell directly from the Formula Bar.
  • The Formula Bar is located just above the worksheet grid, making it easy to view and edit cell contents.
  • Understanding the Formula Bar is essential for working effectively with Excel formulas and data.

question:
Which function key in Excel helps to switch to edit mode?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 08/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• In Excel, the F2 function key is used to switch to Edit Mode for the active cell.
  • When you press F2, the cursor moves to the end of the cell’s content, allowing you to edit it directly.
  • Other function keys like F3 (Paste Name), F7 (Spell Check), and F5 (Go To) serve different purposes.

Additional Information:

  • Using F2 saves time compared to double-clicking the cell to edit.
  • It is a quick way to modify formulas or text within a cell.
  • Familiarity with function keys enhances efficiency in Excel.

question:
In MS-Excel, the spelling tool is placed on which menu bar?

RRB JE 30/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• In MS-Excel, the Spelling tool is located on the Review menu/tab.
  • The Review tab contains tools related to proofreading, comments, and workbook protection.
  • Other menu tabs like Page Layout, Formulas, and Insert serve different purposes such as formatting, calculations, and adding objects.

Additional Information:

  • You can access the spelling check by clicking Review → Spelling or by pressing the shortcut F7.
  • The Spelling tool helps find and correct spelling errors in the worksheet.
  • Knowing the location of the spelling tool helps ensure error-free data entry in Excel.

question: In MS-Excel, what is the shortcut key you can press to select the entire row?
solution:
• In MS-Excel, the shortcut key to select the entire row is Shift + Space.
  • Pressing Shift + Space highlights all the cells in the row of the active cell.
  • Ctrl + Space is used to select the entire column.
  • Other options like Ctrl + Shift + Space select the entire worksheet, and Ctrl + Home moves the cursor to the beginning of the worksheet.

Additional Information:

  • Using Shift + Space helps in quickly formatting, deleting, or copying an entire row.
  • Knowing row and column selection shortcuts improves efficiency in Excel.
  • These shortcuts save time compared to using the mouse.

question: Which of the following is used to cut any text or field in MS-Excel?
solution:
• In MS-Excel, the shortcut to cut any text or field is Ctrl + X.
  • Cutting removes the selected content from its original place and allows you to paste it elsewhere.
  • Ctrl + C is used for copying, Ctrl + A for selecting all, and Alt + C is not a standard shortcut for cutting.

Additional Information:

  • After cutting, you can use Ctrl + V to paste the content in a new location.
  • Using cut and paste helps in moving data efficiently within worksheets.
  • Understanding these shortcuts improves speed and productivity while working in Excel.

question:
The cell with dark boundary in ____________ is called active cell.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 17/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The cell with the dark boundary in MS Excel is called the active cell.
  • The active cell is the currently selected cell where data can be entered or edited.
  • Other options like MS DOS, MS Word, and MS PowerPoint do not use the concept of an active cell with a dark boundary.

Additional Information:

  • The active cell is identified by a thick border around it in the worksheet.
  • Data entered is input into the active cell.
  • Understanding the active cell helps in navigating and working efficiently in Excel.

question:
By default, how many worksheets are present in work book of Excel MS office-2010?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 04/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• By default, an Excel workbook in MS Office 2010 contains 3 worksheets.
  • These worksheets are represented as tabs at the bottom of the workbook window.
  • You can add or remove worksheets as per your requirement.
  • Other options like 1, 2, or 4 worksheets are not the default settings in Excel 2010.

Additional Information:

  • Having multiple worksheets allows better organization and management of related data within one file.
  • You can rename, move, or copy worksheets easily.
  • Knowing the default number helps in understanding workbook structure.

question:
In MS-Excel, how to use format painter multiple times?

RRB JE Stage-II 28/08/2019 (Shift-I)
option_1: By clicking on lock format painter Icon
option_2: By double clicking on the format painter Icon
option_3: By single clicking on the format painter Icon
option_4: Format painter cannot be used multiple times
solution:
• In MS-Excel, to use the Format Painter multiple times, you double-click on the Format Painter icon.
  • Double-clicking locks the Format Painter, allowing you to apply the copied formatting to multiple cells or ranges until you deactivate it by pressing Esc or clicking the Format Painter icon again.
  • Single click applies formatting only once.
  • There is no “lock format painter icon” option, and format painter can be used multiple times by double-clicking.

Additional Information:

  • Format Painter copies formatting such as font, color, borders, and number formats.
  • Using double-click to lock Format Painter improves efficiency when applying the same format repeatedly.
  • This feature is common in MS Office applications like Word and PowerPoint as well.

question:
In Excel, what shortcut key is used to fill the selected cell with active cells to the right?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• In Excel, the shortcut key to fill the selected cell(s) with the contents of the active cell to the right is Ctrl + R.
  • This shortcut copies the content from the cell immediately to the left of the selected range to the selected cells on the right.
  • Other options:
    • Ctrl + V is used for paste,
    • Ctrl + S is used for save,
    • Ctrl + D fills down (copies from above).

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + R is useful for quickly copying data horizontally across a row.
  • It helps in filling formulas, values, or formatting efficiently.
  • Understanding this shortcut enhances productivity while working with Excel.

question:
What is the function called inside a function in MS-Excel?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 28/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• In MS-Excel, a function called inside another function is known as a Nested function.
  • Nested functions allow you to combine multiple functions to perform complex calculations or operations.
  • Other options like Round function, Sandwich function, and Switch function are specific functions but do not describe this concept.

Additional Information:

  • Nesting functions increases the flexibility and power of Excel formulas.
  • For example, =IF(A1>10, ROUND(B1,2), SUM(C1:C5)) uses nested functions IF, ROUND, and SUM.
  • Understanding nested functions helps in creating advanced formulas.

question:
The default width of a column in MS-Excel is:

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The default width of a column in MS-Excel is 8 characters.
  • This means that the default column width can display approximately 8 standard-sized characters in a cell.
  • Other options like 6, 7, or 9 characters are incorrect for the default setting.

Additional Information:

  • The column width can be adjusted manually to fit more or fewer characters as needed.
  • Knowing the default width helps in designing spreadsheets and managing layout effectively.
  • Excel measures column width in terms of the number of characters of the default font that can fit in the cell.

question:
What will happen when you select the cell contents of a particular row in MS-Excel and then click the Delete button?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
option_1: Entries in all the selected cells will be deleted
option_2: Only first three cells will be deleted
option_3: Entire row will be deleted
option_4: First five cell entries will be deleted
solution:
• When you select the cell contents of a particular row in MS-Excel and then click the Delete button, entries in all the selected cells will be deleted.
  • This action clears the content from the selected cells but does not delete the cells themselves or the entire row.
  • Options like deleting the entire row or only some cells are incorrect for this action.

Additional Information:

  • To delete the entire row, you need to right-click the row number and choose "Delete".
  • The Delete key only removes data, not the structure of the worksheet.
  • Knowing this helps prevent accidental deletion of rows or columns.

question:
In Microsoft Excel, which chart type is best suited for comparing proportions or percentages of a whole?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• In Microsoft Excel, the chart type best suited for comparing proportions or percentages of a whole is the Pie Chart.
  • Pie charts visually represent parts of a whole as slices of a circle, making it easy to see relative sizes.
  • Other chart types like Bar, Scatter, and Line charts are used for different types of data comparison and trends.

Additional Information:

  • Pie charts are useful when you want to show how individual categories contribute to the total.
  • They are not ideal for showing changes over time or precise comparisons between many categories.
  • Knowing which chart to use improves data presentation clarity.

question:
Which of the following steps is used to format a cell in an MS Excel Spreadsheet?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
option_1: Menu – Select cell – Format
option_2: Select cell – Right click – Format cell
option_3: Select cell – View – Format cell
option_4: View – Select cell – Format
solution:
• The correct step to format a cell in an MS Excel spreadsheet is: Select cell → Right click → Format cell.
  • This method opens the Format Cells dialog box where you can change number formats, alignment, font, border, fill, and protection settings.
  • Other options like using the View menu or selecting format without right-clicking are incorrect or incomplete steps.

Additional Information:

  • Right-clicking is a quick and common way to access cell formatting options.
  • Formatting cells properly enhances the readability and presentation of data.
  • Knowing this step improves efficiency in working with Excel spreadsheets.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an alignment option for text in a cell?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 15/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The option that is NOT an alignment option for text in a cell in Excel is Justified.
  • Excel supports Left, Center, and Right alignment for text in cells.
  • Justified alignment, which aligns text evenly along both left and right margins, is not available for cell text in Excel.

Additional Information:

  • Justified alignment is commonly found in word processors like MS Word.
  • Excel focuses more on data alignment with simpler options.
  • Understanding alignment options helps in formatting spreadsheets clearly.

question:
Rows in MS-Excel are identified by:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 15/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• In MS-Excel, rows are identified by numbers.
  • Rows run horizontally and are numbered 1, 2, 3, and so on.
  • Columns are identified by letters, not rows.
  • Options like letters, numbers with letters, or timings are incorrect for row identification.

Additional Information:

  • Knowing that rows are numbered helps in cell referencing (e.g., A1 refers to column A, row 1).
  • This identification system makes it easier to navigate and manage spreadsheets.
  • Understanding rows and columns is fundamental to using Excel effectively.

question:
Which MS Excel function can be used to sum up the numbers entered in a group of cells?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The MS Excel function used to sum up the numbers entered in a group of cells is SUM.
  • The SUM function adds all the numeric values within the specified range of cells.
  • Other options like COUNT count the number of numeric entries, AVERAGE calculates the mean, and MAX finds the maximum value.

Additional Information:

  • SUM is one of the most commonly used functions in Excel for quick addition.
  • You can use SUM with cell ranges like =SUM(A1:A10).
  • Understanding the SUM function is fundamental for data analysis in Excel.

question:
Which Excel feature allows you to simultaneously edit the same cell or range of cells with multiple users in real-time?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The Excel feature that allows multiple users to simultaneously edit the same cell or range of cells in real-time is called Co-authoring.
  • Co-authoring enables collaboration where changes are visible instantly to all users working on the document.
  • Other options like Data Validation, Conditional Formatting, and Track Changes serve different functions such as restricting input, formatting based on conditions, and tracking edits.

Additional Information:

  • Co-authoring requires the workbook to be saved on a cloud platform like OneDrive or SharePoint.
  • It enhances teamwork by allowing multiple contributors to work together seamlessly.
  • Understanding co-authoring improves collaborative efficiency.

question:
Formulas in MS-Excel always start with which of the following symbols?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• Formulas in MS-Excel always start with the symbol = (equal sign).
  • The equal sign tells Excel that the following characters constitute a formula or function to be calculated.
  • Other symbols like ==, -, and ! are not used to start formulas in Excel.

Additional Information:

  • Starting a formula with = is essential for Excel to differentiate between data and calculations.
  • You can enter mathematical operations, functions, and references after the equal sign.
  • Understanding this helps in creating correct formulas for data analysis.

question:
Which function is used to calculate the maximum value in a selected column in MS Excel?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 15/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The function used to calculate the maximum value in a selected column in MS Excel is MAX.
  • The MAX function returns the largest numeric value from the specified range of cells.
  • Other options like Auto max, High, and Auto high are not valid Excel functions.

Additional Information:

  • You can use the formula like =MAX(A1:A10) to find the highest value in cells A1 to A10.
  • Knowing the MAX function helps in data analysis and finding peak values.
  • It is one of the basic and frequently used Excel functions.

question:
What is the purpose of the ‘Undo’ command in Microsoft Excel?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: It inserts a new worksheet.
option_2: It copies selected cells.
option_3: It reverses the last action performed.
option_4: It saves the current workbook.
solution:
• The Undo command in MS Excel is used to reverse the last action performed by the user, such as typing, formatting, or deleting content.
  • It helps correct mistakes without manually fixing them.

Additional Information:

  • Shortcut key for Undo is Ctrl + Z .
  • You can press it multiple times to reverse several previous actions in order.
  • It is a standard feature in most MS Office applications.

question:
How to quickly delete a row in Excel without using ribbon or menu?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Select the row and press Alt+Delete.
option_2: Select the row and press Shift+Delete.
option_3: Select the row and press the Delete key.
option_4: Select the row and press Ctrl and the − (minus) key.
solution:
• In MS Excel 365 , the fastest way to delete an entire selected row without using the mouse or right-click menu is by pressing Ctrl + – (minus) .
  • This opens the Delete dialog , where you can confirm to delete the entire row .
  • It saves time, especially when working with large datasets.

Additional Information:

  • Pressing Delete key only clears the content , not the entire row.
  • Alt + Delete and Shift + Delete do not delete the full row.
  • You can also use Ctrl + – to delete columns or cells , depending on selection.

question:
Incorrect statement related to cell addressing in MS Excel?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: The cell in the first column and first row is A1.
option_2: Rows in MS Excel are identified by numbers.
option_3: The cell in the second column and third row is B3.
option_4: Columns in MS Excel are identified by numbers.
solution:
• In MS Excel , columns are identified by letters (A, B, C, ..., Z, AA, AB, etc.) , not by numbers.
  • Rows are identified by numbers (1, 2, 3, ...).
  • So, a cell like A1 refers to column A and row 1 , and B3 refers to column B and row 3 .
  • Therefore, the statement "Columns in MS Excel are identified by numbers" is incorrect .

Additional Information:

  • The cell address is always written as ColumnLetterRowNumber (e.g., D5, F12).
  • Excel has 16,384 columns (A to XFD) and 1,048,576 rows in a single worksheet.

question:
Excel shortcut to make a cell editable?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Pressing F2 in MS Excel activates edit mode for the currently selected cell, placing the cursor at the end of its contents.
  • This allows you to modify cell contents directly without retyping the entire value.
  • Using F2 is faster than doubleclicking the cell or navigating to the formula bar.

Additional Information:

  • F1 opens the Help pane in Excel, not edit mode.
  • Ctrl + F1 toggles the ribbon display on and off.
  • Ctrl + F2 opens the Print Preview in Excel.

question:
Term for formatted data area in Excel for printing?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The Print Area is a specified range of cells that you designate for printing, so only that selected region is printed.
  • You set it via Page Layout→ Print Area → Set Print Area , after selecting the desired cells.
  • Defining a print area helps ensure consistent and precise output , especially for reports and dashboards.

Additional Information:

  • Use Page Layout→ Print Area → Clear Print Area to remove a previously defined area.
  • Print Preview (Ctrl + P) shows how the print area will appear on paper.
  • You can define multiple print areas on a sheet; Excel will treat each as a separate page.

question:
Which is NOT a type of chart in Excel?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• There is no chart named Space chart included in Excel; this is an invalid choice.
  • Line chart, Bar chart, and Pie chart are all chart templates available in Excel.
  • To insert a chart, you can select any valid chart type from the Insert→Charts group.

Additional Information:

  • Other valid chart types in Excel are Scatter, Area, Doughnut, Column, etc.
  • You can customize options such as data series, labels, and invisible axis in the chart settings.
  • You can change the visibility and style of the chart from the Chart Design and Format tabs in the Chart Tools ribbon.

question:
Option to save workbook as macro-enabled with new name/location in Excel?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Save As opens a dialog where you can specify a new file name, location , and choose “Excel Macro-Enabled Workbook (*.xlsm )” as the file type.
  • This ensures your workbook’s macros are preserved in the newly saved file.
  • Other options like Save a Copy may duplicate the file but don’t always prompt for file type selection, while Save Workspace and Save Excel aren’t used for this purpose.

Additional Information:

  • After choosing Save As , set Save as type to Excel Macro-Enabled Workbook (*.xlsm ) from the dropdown.
  • Keyboard shortcut F12 also brings up the Save As dialog instantly.
  • Regular Save (Ctrl + S) won’t allow changing file type or location without Save As.

question:
Correct way to sort range in ascending order in Excel?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Select the range of cells and press ‘Ctrl + Shift + S’.
option_2: Click on the ‘Review’ tab and select ‘Sort’.
option_3: In the ‘Sort’ dialog box, select the ‘Ascending’ option in the ‘Order’ section.
option_4: Click on the ‘OK’ button.
solution:
• Open the Sort dialog by selecting your range and clicking Sort (usually under the Data tab or Home→ Sort & Filter).
  • In the dialog’s Order dropdown, choose Ascending to sort from smallest to largest or A→ Z.
  • Confirm by clicking OK —but selecting Ascending in the Order section is the key step to specify ascending order.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl+ Shift + S is not a default Excel shortcut for sorting.
  • The Review tab deals with spell check, comments, and protecting sheets, not sorting.
  • Simply clicking OK without choosing ascending would apply the last-used sort settings, which may not be ascending.

question:
Option to open spreadsheet in MS Excel 2007

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The Office button in Excel 2007 provides the commands to open new or existing workbooks.
  • It’s located at the top-left corner , replacing the traditional File menu in later versions.
  • You can press Alt+F to quickly open the Office button menu.

Additional Information:

  • The Office button also grants access to Save , Print , and Excel Options .
  • From Excel 2010 onward, the Office button was replaced by the File tab and Backstage view.
  • Using the Office button menu is essential for managing file-level tasks in Excel 2007.

question:
What in Excel has a dollar sign ($) before row/column?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_3: Both absolute reference and mixed reference
solution:
• Absolute references use a dollar sign before both the column letter and row number (e.g., $A$1).
  • Mixed references use a dollar sign before either the column or the row (e.g., $A1 or A$1).
  • Therefore, both absolute and mixed references include a $ in front of the column letter and/or row number.

Additional Information:

  • Relative references (e.g., A1) change based on where the formula is copied and contain no dollar signs.
  • The dollar sign “locks” the specified part: $A$1 locks both, $A1 locks column, and A$1locks row.
  • Using mixed references is useful when you want one dimension fixed (column or row) while allowing the other to adjust.

question:
Which of the following is an example of a spreadsheet?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 07/04/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Microsoft Excel is an example of a spreadsheet program.
  • Spreadsheets are used for organizing, analyzing, and storing data in tabular form using rows and columns.
  • Other options like Microsoft Outlook (email client), Microsoft PowerPoint (presentation software), and Microsoft Word (word processor) serve different purposes.

Additional Information:

  • Excel allows users to perform calculations, create charts, and use formulas.
  • It is widely used for financial analysis, data management, and reporting.
  • Understanding what a spreadsheet is helps in choosing the right software for data tasks.
